- Topic: Creation of City of New Orleans Home Rule Charter Review Committee
- Summary: Councilmember Morrell introduced a motion authorizing the creation of an advisory committee, known as the City of New Orleans Home Rule Charter Review Committee, to review and make non-binding recommendations regarding potential changes to the Home Rule Charter. The motion was referred to the Governmental Affairs Committee and continued to the second meeting of January 2024.

- Topic: Support for victim safeguards in domestic violence cases
- Summary: Councilmembers Moreno and Green introduced a resolution expressing the City Council's support for the addition of victim safeguards in severe domestic violence incidents. The resolution urged the Criminal District Court and the Orleans Parish District Attorney's Office to conduct Gwen's Law hearings for specific domestic abuse battery cases. The resolution passed with 6 YEAS and 0 NAYS, with 1 member absent.
- Ordinance Number: R-23-376
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)

- Topic: Amendment to Section 26-236 of the Code of the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance proposed several amendments to Section 26-236 to address urban blight and its negative impact on neighborhoods and residents' health. The amendments include defining blighted properties, empowering hearing officers to declare premises as blight and public nuisance, and removing specific references to vacant properties. 
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a majority vote, indicating support for the proposed amendments to address urban blight in the city.
- Tags/Keywords: Urban blight, Property blight, Public nuisance, Neighborhood health
- UID: 838044a6-996c-4dd8-bfad-ce24c50f7391

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Vacant Structure Blight and Public Nuisance Ordinance
- Summary: This ordinance proposed amendments to the existing vacant structure blight and public nuisance ordinance, outlining the criteria for declaring a vacant structure as blight and public nuisance. The amendments also detailed the process for owners or occupants to avoid such a declaration by undertaking and completing necessary renovation work. The ordinance aimed to address the issue of vacant structures in the city and ensure that they are either renovated or brought into compliance with occupancy standards.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendments to the vacant structure blight and public nuisance ordinance were passed, allowing for the implementation of the outlined criteria and process for addressing vacant structures.
- Tags/Keywords: Vacant Structure, Blight, Public Nuisance, Renovation, Compliance
- UID: 283bdd48-803d-45d3-849d-c894fa075f4e

- Topic: Amending the Home Rule Charter
- Summary: An ordinance calling an election on October 14, 2023, at which the electors of the City of New Orleans shall be asked to approve amendments to the Home Rule Charter related to the submission of operating budgets, capital programs, and budget ordinances. The ordinance was passed.
- Ordinance Number: 34070
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendments to the Home Rule Charter were approved for submission to the electors in an upcoming election.

- Topic: Establishment of the Department of Code Enforcement
- Summary: An ordinance calling an election on October 14, 2023, at which the electors of the City of New Orleans shall be asked to approve an amendment to the Home Rule Charter to establish the Department of Code Enforcement and reassign certain duties. The ordinance was passed.
- Ordinance Number: 34071
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)

- Topic: Amendment to Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance to establish a new Interim Zoning District
- Summary: Ordinance No. 4264 M.C.S. was amended to establish a new Interim Zoning District (IZD) named the Historic Urban Neighborhood Commercial Short Term Rental Interim Zoning District. The intent of the IZD is to prohibit the use of Short Term Rental, Commercial within all areas of the City of New Orleans zoned HU-MU Neighborhood Mixed Use District. The ordinance passed with 7 YEAS and 0 NAYS.
- Ordinance Number: Ordinance No. 4264 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Prohibited the use of Short Term Rental, Commercial in specific zoning districts
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Interim Zoning District, Short Term Rental, Commercial
- UID: b600bbe7-5bc1-48c9-92af-0726b8b07fee

- Topic: Amendment to Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance to create a new zoning classification
- Summary: Motion M-23-Z directed the City Planning Commission to conduct a public hearing to consider amendments to create a new zoning classification, VCR-3, to allow primarily residential uses, limited to singles, doubles, educational, and cultural uses. The motion was continued to the meeting of 3/23/23.
- Ordinance Number: M-23-Z
- Votes Summary: Not applicable
- Decision/Key Actions: Directed the City Planning Commission to conduct a public hearing for amendments
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, New Zoning Classification, Residential Uses
- UID: b600bbe7-5bc1-48c9-92af-0726b8b07fee

- Summary: The council passed three ordinances to amend the operating budget for the City of New Orleans for the year 2023. The first ordinance transferred funds awarded by the Corporation for National and Community Service to the Mayor’s Office AmeriCorps Vista Program. The second and third ordinances appropriated grant funds to cover payroll expenses incurred during the grant period of January 26, 2021 through September 30, 2022.

- Topic: Short Term Rental Permit Lotteries
- Summary: The Department of Safety and Permits submitted proposed regulations governing Short Term Rental Permit Lotteries, along with a legal notice of public hearing and a summary of comments received at the public hearing and virtual listening session. The motion to suspend the rules and add the item to the agenda both passed unanimously.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:

- Decision/Key Actions: The proposed regulations governing Short Term Rental Permit Lotteries were added to the agenda and the rules were suspended to facilitate further discussion and potential adoption.

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance for Electric Vehicle Charging Stations
- Summary: The ordinance proposed the insertion of new columns for electric vehicle charging station minimum requirements in the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance. It outlined the percentage of total required off-street vehicle parking spaces with level 2 or level 3 electric vehicle charging stations installed and the percentage of total required off-street vehicle parking spaces that are electric vehicle charging ready, with specific requirements for various types of establishments. The ordinance also included footnotes for off-street parking providing 10 or more spaces. 
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 4 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was passed with a majority vote.
- Tags/Keywords: Electric Vehicle Charging Stations, Zoning Ordinance, Off-Street Parking
- UID: d8cb785f-6a70-40e8-be49-31028986a343
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 5-25-2023

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Electric Vehicle Charging Standards
- Summary: The ordinance introduces requirements for off-street parking with 10 or more spaces to include Level 2 and Level 3 Electric Vehicle Charging Stations. It also allows for reductions in required parking spaces when non-required EV Charging Stations are voluntarily installed.
- Ordinance Number: Not specified
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 1 NAY, 2 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a 6-1 vote, allowing for reductions in required parking spaces for the installation of EV Charging Stations.
- Tags/Keywords: Electric Vehicle Charging, Off-Street Parking, Reductions, Voluntary Installation
- UID: c8cf8c16-4aa8-4c14-b4a4-c8fc80d7f3d8

- Summary: The ordinance directs the City Planning Commission to conduct a public hearing to consider amending the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance to expand community solar opportunities. It includes considerations for defining "Community Solar Projects," creating accessory use standards, and amending Article 21.6.J of the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a majority vote, allowing for the expansion of community solar opportunities and the consideration of various amendments to the zoning ordinance.
- Tags/Keywords: Community Solar, Zoning Ordinance, Public Hearing
- UID: 990f83ad-5c0f-4707-af79-6ed302998630

- Summary: The ordinance aims to establish the Brown's Dairy Neighborhood District overlay, maintain and create affordable housing opportunities, and prohibit certain types of rentals in the specified area. 
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 34,282
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without any amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Affordable Housing, Rental Prohibition
- UID: 3f7b72c0-04af-4916-aa65-20cf22d101c1

- Topic: Temporary Waiver of Fees for Event at Morris FX Jeff Sr. Stadium
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to temporarily waive certain fees and permit requirements for an event at Morris FX Jeff Sr. Stadium.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 34,283
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: Passed - (9 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without any amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Fee Waiver, Event, Stadium
- UID: 3f7b72c0-04af-4916-aa65-20cf22d101c1

- Topic: Establishment of Outside Employment Rules for the Medical Director of Emergency Medical Services
- Summary: This ordinance aims to establish rules for outside employment for the Medical Director of Emergency Medical Services.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 34,284
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 1 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with one dissenting vote.
- Tags/Keywords: Employment Rules, Medical Director, Emergency Medical Services
- UID: 3f7b72c0-04af-4916-aa65-20cf22d101c1

- Topic: Cable Franchise Amendment
- Summary: An ordinance to amend selected provisions of Ordinance Number 24698 M.C.S. granting a Cable Franchise to Cox Communications Louisiana, L.L.C. for the City of New Orleans. The ordinance was introduced by Councilmember Morrell.
- Ordinance Number: 34288
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without any amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Cable Franchise, Cox Communications, Councilmember Morrell
- UID: c4300c5c-26cd-41fa-8bdb-fad4b20d705e

- Topic: Opioid Crisis Funding
- Summary: An ordinance to appropriate court settlement funds to the Health Department for the Opioid Abatement Task Force to address issues related to the Opioid Crisis. The ordinance was introduced by Councilmembers Giarrusso, Moreno, Green, and Thomas.
- Ordinance Number: 34289
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 1 NAY, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a majority vote, with no further amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Opioid Crisis, Health Department, Councilmembers Giarrusso, Moreno, Green, Thomas
- UID: c4300c5c-26cd-41fa-8bdb-fad4b20d705e

- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement
- Summary: An ordinance authorizing the Mayor of the City of New Orleans to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement between the City of New Orleans and Ujamaa Economic Development Corporation, Inc. for the public purpose of establishing the Claiborne Corridor Cultural Innovation District. The ordinance was introduced by Councilmember King.
- Ordinance Number: 34290
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a majority vote, with no further amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement, Ujamaa Economic Development Corporation, Councilmember King
- UID: c4300c5c-26cd-41fa-8bdb-fad4b20d705e

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment of Section 82-697 of the Code of the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance aims to allow for the removal of personal items outside of tents at encampment areas. The vote resulted in the ordinance being passed.
- Ordinance Number: 34307
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was passed, allowing for the removal of personal items outside of tents at encampment areas.
- UID: 4e1b140e-9dd6-4d99-9d17-91464abf01ad

- Topic: Amendment of Sections 82-410 and 82-412
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to increase penalties and provide regulations for food waste and distribution of food under or adjacent to overpasses or within encampment areas. The vote resulted in the ordinance being passed.
- Ordinance Number: 34308
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was passed, increasing penalties and providing regulations for food waste and distribution of food in specific areas.
- UID: 4e1b140e-9dd6-4d99-9d17-91464abf01ad
